attributes.action: Make Eastwood Park a safer place for the community
attributes.additional_details: During the night the atmosphere of the park becomes very unsettling and many people try to avoid it as a result of this. The lighting is very dim and you can not see more than a meter or two in front of you. A lot of people deliberately avoid going through it late at night because of this.
attributes.background: Eastwood Park has slowly become increasingly unsafe and has high rates of anti-social behavior, such as drug and alcohol use, noise pollution and 2 recorded stabbings in the past three years by the nearby block of flats, Beaver Towers.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issues you raise. 

Crime and anti-social behavior is the responsibility of your local police. You could contact your police and crime commissioner (PCC) to make a suggestion or a complaint about policing in your local area:

https://www.gov.uk/police-and-crime-commissioners

Lighting in Eastwood Park is the responsibility of your local council. You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
